Reviews.Title: “A romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Kim E
Reviews.Content: A nice place to celebrate a anniversary or having a couple retreat. We stayed there in April and enjoyed it. Our room was located at ground floor next to the reception and pool. The rooms had 2 huge beds, Nespresso coffee maker, jacuzzi, private outside area. The breakfast area is in the reception with the option to sit outside by the pool. The had 2 chefs making omelette, and 1 that made Belgian waffles.

Reviews.Title: “Mellowing out in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: JWP8
Reviews.Content: We had a beautiful -- but way too brief -- weekend stay at the Vintage Inn. The complimentary breakfast was wonderful; complimentary wine; very nice staff. In fact, watching the clean up staff limber up for their day was an interesting lesson in good management. They were ready, cheerful, effective -- and that wouldn't happen w/out caring employers. So, in addition to all the other great things others have mentioned, there were also good vibes. May be pricey, but sometimes a splurge is good for the soul.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing....one of the best.”
Reviews.Author: sheeney7
Reviews.Content: Wow, what an incredible stay we just had here. My husband and I decided to head to Napa for the weekend-but we had no reservations booked, and I walked in the lobby at 4:00PM and asked if they had any last minute specials. They offered me a King room at $295, which he said was normally $435, and rates jump up to $600 in the summer. So that was fantastic. What I didn't know was how much it included! Wifi, a lovely bottle of wine in the room (lovely fireplace as well), "high tea" which was this wonderful display of beautiful appetizers and tea, wine and cheese hour, which included meat, crackers, olives, cream cheese stuffed jalepenos (were to die for!), and then came the wonderful amazing GORMET breakfast/brunch in the morning. It was stunning. Everything was over the top. Organic everything, champagne, fresh squeezed orange juice, waffle station, omelet station, fruit, bread, potatoes, the most amazing carrots....oh so good. And on top of all of the wonderful food, everyone was so nice. I was treated like a princess from the moment I arrived. Oh and the room...I am particular with smells....my nose is very sensitive....but the room had such a lovely fresh clean scent to it. I loved the rainfall shower head. Bed was extremely comfortable. We would return back to this place in a heartbeat! Oh and the robes....not your typical itchy white hotel robes...these were so soft and luxurious. Loved them. The hotel seemed to get every detail right. Actually except two things: my husband and I are avid coffee lovers, and in the morning we realized they only gave us one tiny little thing of half and half, not even enough for one cup of coffee. But my husband called and they brought more up right away. The other thing that kind of bothered me was a man that worked there....Luis....he was waiting for us to leave our table after breakfast so he could clean it. He was hovering, and kept giving me dirty looks like "come on, get moving guys!". I felt it was rude and felt rushed, which is not good to feel on vacation. But other than those two things, the place was perfect :))

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel, lovely grounds, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: AllieAn
Reviews.Content: Based on the layout i think rooms are very similar throughout the property. Ours was large, comfortably furnished, with fireplace, large bathroom, and balcony. Coffee and nespresso machine, complimentary wine on arrival, water bottles with turn down service, and many other amenities. I expect that rooms close to the highway may have some issues with noise. The grounds are lovely as is the small pool and breakfast area. Breakfast was delicious with made-to-order eggs, many fresh fruit and vegetable dishes and Mumm champagne. There is afternoon tea with delicious scones and chocolates as well. It was too cold to use the pool, but it was a pretty, very intimate area, which I expect to be very inviting for relaxation. There is complimentary use of the Villagio spa facilities, but we did not use it. It is a 5-10 minute walk - not close enough to slip into your bath robe and use their steam room or sauna. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would return. The only downside is Yountville itself: great restaurants, but the town is developing into something close to Disneyland. Not much left of a sleepy village in Napa valley that happened to have great chefs and excellent wineries.

Reviews.Title: “Well located hotel with comfortable amenities”
Reviews.Author: MBA60302
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Vintage Inn while exploring wine country. Our room was comfortably sized and well furnished with a king-size bed, fireplace, and spacious bathroom. The only oddity is the lack of any closet at all in the bedroom, with only a small armoire in the bathroom - perhaps of no moment if you are merely traveling for a few days in Napa, but less convenient if your stay is part of a longer trip, especially if you have business attire that you'd like to hang out. The "champagne" breakfast includes a generous and varied buffet selection, plus made to order omelet bar. Can't speak to the champagne, though, as our days were so full of wine that breakfast was the one meal that we were teetotalers. Only complaint was the inadequate amount of seating for breakfast. It was cool and rainy while we were there so the outdoor seating, which evidently accommodates many of the guests on nicer days, was not in use. There was another room on the other side of the hotel lobby for some overflow guests but it was charmless and still not sufficiently large to accommodate those who could not find seating in the main breakfast area. Also beware that the owners have at least 2 cats that roam freely in the commons area, including the upholstered furniture in the lobby and breakfast area;even if you don't see the cats, you will be aware of them, if you are highly allergic. The inn is excellently located, almost directly across the street from the French Laundry, and within a few blocks of many of Yountville's other restaurants. We had one awkward moment on our last day, when we returned to our room and found a voicemail to the effect that we had overstayed our "two day" reservation and therefore our 3rd night would be at the rack rate rather than the discount that we had procured from an online discount site. Fortunately we were traveling with the receipt confirmation showing our prepaid reservation for 3 nights and the hotel dropped the matter. We were never sure whether the mixup was an honest mistake or an effort of the management to extract a premium on a Saturday night when they and all the other hotels in the area were sold out.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Place to stay - after a big meal!”
Reviews.Author: WilCorCla
Reviews.Content: After 3 months of trying, we finally got a reservation with French Laundry! The reservation was 9pm. We decided we would fully (and slowly) engoy our meal - i.e. eating and drinking as much as French Laundry can offer.With that in mind, we decided to find a place so we can stay the night after the big meal. That's where Vintage Inn came in. Since our mind was set on French Laundry, we didn't really pay much attention to where we stayed. We checked the Vintage Inn website, and saw that it had good, spacious room & looked clean so we booked it. Vintage Inn was only a stone throw away from French Laundry which made it an ideal place for us. The room price was very reasonable. We checked in the room around 7pm. The front-desk folks were extremely helpful and friendly. There was a bottle of cold/chilled white wine waiting for us. The room was clean, big, and very comfortable. The bath room has a jacuzzi & very big. We were able to rest up a bit before getting ready for our big meal. We did have a great time eating in FL (who won't?). We came back to the hotel too stuff to do anything. The next day, we were planning to skip the breakfast; and we were glad we didn't. Vintage Inn offered a very nice and "big" breakfast with lots of fresh fruits. They also had a chef there to make omelette the way you want. Everything was very delicious. We ended up eating more than we should while still digesting the food from last night. The Inn also offers free afternoon tea, Even though we missed the afternoon tea on the day of the arrival; the front desk folks told me to come back to try after we checked out. We didn't do that because we were already re-stuffed in the nearby Bouchon Bakery. All in all - No regrets - gained at least 5 lbs. This hotel is really a nice compliment for your trip to Yountville - especially if you are doing FL.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: LBG2012
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent one night here for our fifth anniversary. We received a complimentary upgrade to one of the villas and it was beautiful. We arrived at tea time and enjoyed some scones, biscotti, croissant sandwiches, tea and lemonade then we settled into our room and enjoyed some wine from the complimentary bottle in our room and a fire during a torrential downpour. We weren't there long enough, but they told us we had access to spa at the Villagio (sauna, steam room, etc.) as well as the gym in town. The location was great as well, a quick walk to Bottega where we had dinner, and practically across the street from Bouchon and an extra block and we were at Ad Hoc. The complimentary breakfast was also superb. A great omelet bar, pastries, bagels and cream cheese, granola, yogurt, and all the champagne you could stomach. Check out wasn't until noon so we had plenty of time to enjoy the deep tub with jets! Overall a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Near the highway, for better and worse”
Reviews.Author: yaneh
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this lovely property, in an upstairs room with a view of the rolling hills and, more immediately, the highway. As many reviewers have pointed out, the highway noise is ever-present in the highway-facing rooms, and even in the courtyard rooms, once the fountains are turned off late at night, you can probably still hear a din inside. Nevertheless, this was one of the most relaxing places I have stayed at in a long time. Charming touches like the fireplaces and complimentary logs, the jet tub, champagne brunch, afternoon tea, resident cats, etc. add to the experience. While being near the highway does take away from the otherwise rural setting, it is very convenient, as many of the restaurants and wineries are a ways away from Yountville and each other. Additionally, staying in Yountville allows you to walk to many terrific restaurants including French Laundry, Bouchon and Redd, though Yountville is not as lively or historic as downtown St Helena or Healdsburg. If we come back to Napa, we would probably opt to stay in the hills (Auberge du Soleil, Solage) or off the Silverado Trail, which has much less traffic than the main highway, and an even more relaxing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Love, love love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: nlwl
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Inn on and off over the past 20 years and it continues to be one of my favorites. It is located in the tiny town of Yountville so it is easy to walk everywhere. The hotel serves a excellent brunch. It is not the heavy "roast beef" style however everything offered is very good. They have added an omlet bar since I was last there but with all the other offerings we did not make it there. They added an afternoon tea which is very good w small sandwiches and deserts. You most likely can tell that I am into food. All too true. Yountville is the home of the top rated resturant The French Laundry. With sufficient notice the hotel can get you a reservation though you may need to be flexible on the time. Back to the hotel: there is a wonderful pool and hot tub, access to a gym (neglected to ck out) and to a spa w/in walking distance. Rooms are large w fireplace, patio/deck and baths have large soaking tubs most likely w bubbles. Again, I did not try. The deep tub may be somewhat difficult to climb in if one has mobility issues however, I am certain they have a variety of rooms. This trip I went w my son. He went bicycling while I walked around, went to the few stores and read.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: JetSetNY22
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Vintage Inn last minute. We wanted to be close to our restaurant reservations. The stay at Vintage Inn was fabulous and friendly. They have two house cats on premises that have the run of the place; they are endearing. They also have an amazing breakfast in the morning, providing everything from fresh omlettes to mimosas and bloody Mary's. We love this place; well worth the cost!

Reviews.Title: “Three words....Manager Jeff Smith”
Reviews.Author: Caroline L
Reviews.Content: Read the details below for the amazing perks of this very special place. This review is 10 years/30 visits past due. If there were an Oscar for the best hotel Manager in Napa Valley Jeff Smith deserves it. Since our first visit 10 years ago until today Jeff makes us and every visitor feel appreciated to chose the Vintage Inn. We have always received exceptional service with room requests, restaurant recommendations, transportation to wineries, ect. We have recommended the Vintage Inn to our friends around the country and they can't thank us enough. Don't make the mistake of going to another newer pricier hotel to be treated like a nobody. The rooms, grounds, brunch, staff ect make the Vintage the perfect choice. Thanks Jeff-- The Logan's

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Inn, Yountville”
Reviews.Author: Still Served Wa... S
Reviews.Content: Amazing place, location, rooms and Spa. And the Signature Champagne Breakfast is addictive! We reviewed it here: http://www.stillservedwarm.com/breakfast-vintage-inn-yountville-napa/

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorite hotels in Napa Area!”
Reviews.Author: Scotty2975
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I recently stayed a night here to celebrate my birthday and had a wonderful time. We stayed there around the same time last year and couldn't pass up on a good internet deal. The hotel grounds are beautifully landscaped and maintained while the rooms themselves are nicely appointed with Nespresso coffee makers, a fire log and complimentary bottle of red or white wine. We enjoyed a dinner at Bouchon across the street so we just had to walk our full bellies back 2 minutes to our room. The hotel staff are professional and very accommodating. The complimentary breakfast and tea time always make our day. My fiancÃ© especially likes the complimentary access to the spa facilities at the adjacent Villagio Inn! No doubt we will be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: prazakr
Reviews.Content: We got a pretty excellent rate for the timeframe we were there (in between Christmas and New Year's). We enjoyed the champagne brunch and fireplace. The bed was not comfortable. It slanted downward from foot to head. I did not sleep well either night. The TV was old, as were all of the furnishings in the room, including the carpet. More of a vintage charm, which is not my thing. The complimentary fitness center was the tiny Yountville Fitness Center down the street. I was disappointed that we could not use the workout facilities at what I thought was their sister property - the Villagio, down the street. The pool area looked nice, although it was too cold for us to use it. We would probably not return.

Reviews.Title: “Wine Country Hit”
Reviews.Author: coastalbrett
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Vintage Inn for her birthday in January 2012 and enjoyed our brief stay. The cook to order breakfast, Friday evening winde tasting and the quality of the service teams were first rate. The only criticism I would give is that the hard wood floors and relatively thin walls and floors make for a noisy stay at best. I would recommend this property however as I don't believe I have ever stayed in a completely sound proof room. Give it a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting”
Reviews.Author: DDTSarasota
Reviews.Content: The Property: Lovely grounds and walkways lined with flowering bushes, trees and waterways. Tranquil heated pool and jacuzzi with comfortable lounge chairs surrounding. The Rooms: Spacious, pleasantly decorated with a homey charm that adds to the Vintage ambiance. The wood burning fireplace is wonderful and romantic. The bathrooms are large and lovely with very nice toiletries. The bed, bedding and pillows are perfectly comfortable and high quality. The Champagne Breakfast: Irresistable and delicious breakfast served, from oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogurt, potatoes, and omelets to the best bread pudding I've ever tasted. Not to mention the devine Champagne and juices to make a little Mimosa to start the day with a sparkle! The Staff: Exceptional, friendly, helpful and professional. Every staff member was kind and courteous from the front desk, breakfast staff to housekeeping. A++! My family consisting of 3 couples stayed at the Vintage Inn for 3 nights and we absolutely loved our stay. Every evening after dinner we gathered by the lobby fire for an after dinner cocktail or 2 to conclude our wonderful day in Napa. We are still talking about how wonderful our visit to the Vintage Inn was.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Inn in the winter wine country”
Reviews.Author: bobSeaCliff
Reviews.Content: Rented room 312 (I believe), with fireplace, 20 foot ceilings, super comfy bed (those pillows!). Breakfast delicious. Spa included, but is about half mile away, and worth the drive/jog. in other words, don't pass this place up if you'll be in Yountville area. BTW, up the route is Mustard's, a not-to-be-missed lunch palace($$$).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful comfortable hotel with great service and food”
Reviews.Author: MDG02186
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Napa and this hotel was a great find. We had an upstairs suite, which was very comfortable and spacious. The grounds are very nice and it looks as though there's a heated pool. We used the local fitness center, which is fine not great, and the spa at the Villagio which was awesome. It's nice to have access to a fitness center. We did the breakfast which was wonderful but missed the tea. Lots of nice touches and the front desk staff was very helpful with special requests, including shipping home wine. Great jacuzzi tub and the bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Vintage Rocks”
Reviews.Author: mele22
Reviews.Content: I spent one night at this inn after NYE, the pros: beautiful room, great amenities the spa at the Vlliagio was nice, high tea was fun and breakfast was excellent and filling.The cons: I just wish I stayed a couple of more nights.

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: spaflorida
Reviews.Content: This hotel in old but very clean my room was very small and I don't like the bed was not confortable the bathroom are big in compare to the room, the breakfast was OK and the service as well. Two years ago I stayed in the Villagio Inn that hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect, but noisy when neighbors are showering and using Jacuzzi”
Reviews.Author: miamimango
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here for the first 3 days. As others reviews have written, big clean comfy rooms. Real fire place and unbelievable breakfast and afternoon tea, never ordered lunch once during our 5 day stay! Used the spa at Villagio which was just heavenly. The only issue was on the last 2 mornings. We got new neighbors with 2 small children who were up by 6 am each morning. The shower running and jacuzzi going (I guess early baths for the kids?) Woke us up well before we were ready! Interestingly we couldn't hear our own shower in the bedroom when it was running in the other room. so I guess just luck of the draw, had they been night showerers or later sleepers we would not have noticed, but it did make us a bit grumpy on those last 2 days (at least until the breakfast mimosa!)

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return”
Reviews.Author: Martini_A_Go_Go
Reviews.Content: I spent an incredibly lovely week at the Vintage Inn in November while on a work project, and fell in love! I've stayed at great hotels around the world, and one thing really struck me about this place: the personalized attention they give every guest. The team there (especially David, Shawn, and Brigette) went above and beyond to accommodate any and every special request. And even the basics are special at The Vintage. From the wood-burning fireplaces, complimentary wine, massive jetted tubs (probably the biggest tub I've ever had in a hotel), complimentary breakfast (a super elaborate buffet), complimentary usage of the spa facilities, gorgeous grounds... I left feeling rejuvenated, and I had been there for work! I also visited the spa for 2 massages during the week. Excellent. The spa staff were all very polite and professional, and facilities are just beautiful. I especially loved the outdoor hot tub and fireplace. Yountville is a great little town too. So far, it's my favorite place to stay in Napa... It's an adorable town, and you can cover the whole thing on foot. I'll be back soon! The only thing I'll do different next time is make weekend dinner reservations further in advance...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for a romantic weekend!!!”
Reviews.Author: AmyandChuck2010
Reviews.Content: I had the luxury of staying at the Vintage Inn for a work meeting for 2 nights. I only wish that my husband could have joined me as this is the perfect place for a couple to have a lovely wine getaway. We come to Napa at least once a year, and we always stay at a chain hotel on reward points. I would pay to stay here. First, the location is spectacular. Yountville is absolutely my favorite area of Napa due to its central location with crossroads to the Silverado Trail & Hwy 29 but also for our favorite restaurants & awesome boutique shopping. The Vintage Inn is across the street from Bouchon, next to Bottega and within very easy walking distance of Ad Hoc & Bistro Jeanty. Seriously, stay 4 nights so that you can eat at all of them. Ridiculously good. The Inn.....a rustic charm that is so sweet & romantic. Wide planked hardwood floors, a jet tub big enough for two people, a fireplace with a complimentary Duraflame log provided each day, a huge (and delicious) breakfast each morning with an omelet station & everything else you could dream of, and afternoon tea service with yummy treats. The beds are big & comfortable with cozy bedding, and the bathroom amenties smell great. Everything was as clean as you could want including the fireplace. I've never stayed anywhere where I was as comfortable getting into the tub without first cleaning it myself! If I had to provide a complaint it would be that I was on the lower level (2 story buildings throughout the property) so I could hear people walking on the hardwood floors. Otherwise, pretty quiet overall. The grounds are lovely & park like. Cool water features throughout and it looks like the pool is heated if the steam coming off it was any indication. Nice staff. Great place for a very small corporate meeting which is what I experienced with 9 of my co-workers. I would highly recommend for a romantic anniversary, birthday, proposal, honeymoon, babymoon etc. My husband is kicking himself for not coming with me!

Reviews.Title: “Always a great choice!”
Reviews.Author: oshkoshtraveler61
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed another stay at the Vintage Inn the beginning of November, and everything was excellent as it was on 4 previous visits. When planning this years trip, I tried hard to choose another inn mainly for a little variety. After looking at all the choices, I decided our best bet for the money was still the Vintage Inn. The inn has a warm, welcoming feel, and the staff is very friendly & helpful. The morning breakfast is excellent. We had a another great stay, and I think it's the only place I'll stay from now on. Great central location for lodging, wining and dining make this inn hard to beat!!

Reviews.Title: “Renew Yourself at the Vintage Inn”
Reviews.Author: LifeIsMyGame
Reviews.Content: My husband had a business meeting with his boss and they always love to go to The Vintage Inn. I have accompanied them in the past and was invited again. Yountville is a lovely little town and the Inn is right across from several excellent restaurants. I could only stay one night and we had dinner at Bouchon, which never disappoints. The lamb was delicious. At the Inn, they had wine tasting and hors d'oeuvres at the lobby which was very welcoming with the lit fireplace. Our room had a fireplace as well, wine, a refrigerator, high ceilings and a great bathroom with a jacuzzi tub. The sinks were on a beautiful cabinet (furniture like, not built in). The staff was very helpful and professional. It is a beautiful, romantic place. We added to that by visiting the nearby Castello di Amorosa in Calistoga, about half hour away. I wished I had had more time. I gave only 4 stars to Sleep Quality because the bed was a little high for me.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay! Great Napa experience!”
Reviews.Author: Queentyd
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our first trip to napa last week. The grounds are meticulously manicured & gorgeous with the man made creek running through the property & numerous areas to sit & enjoy the quiet & beauty. The rooms are nicely appointed with a fireplace & were quite large. The bathroom was nice as well w/jacuzzi tub/shower combination. It was a little difficult getting in and out of when showering though. The breakfast (included) was out of this world! There are plenty of restaurants within walking distance & shopping, as well.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic, Relaxing, Charming Ambience”
Reviews.Author: Georgia L
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend after a business meeting at this hotel. The grounds are landscaped meticulously and are luscious. We had a second floor room, which is the top floor. The room had a vaulted ceiling, fireplace, jacuzzi tub and beautiful balcony. The room also came with a complimentary bottle of wine, espresso machine and coffee pot and a refrigerator. It was very enjoyable. The complimentary breakfast buffet is among the best I have seen. It includes cooked to order eggs and omeletes, champagne and Bloody Mary bar, and everything else you would expect. Fresh pastries, salmon, meats, fresh fruit and yogurts. They also have an afternoon tea which is very tempting! The location is fantastic. In the same center as Bottega and across the street from Bouchon. I wish I could have stayed a bit longer!

Reviews.Title: “Daily Siestas Welcomed!”
Reviews.Author: BevinDPT
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and i stayed here for 4 nights this weekend as my birthday celebration. We loved the coziness of the room, with a fireplace that sealed the deal. The weekend breakfast was incredible as well as afternoon tea, lemonade, apples, etc. Definitely money well spent. The only con i believe is house keeping; although they came twice daily to make your bed and replenish your towels... i thought it was odd, the only necessary items (cotton swabs, q-tips and soap) were never replenished, which im sure the front desk would have made right, had we asked. definitely two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and coziness all in one!”
Reviews.Author: tiagayepfa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this for our honeymoon and remains one of our top places to stay. The wood beamed ceilings, fireplace, wine upon arrival, the pleasures never seemed to end. The Napa area is beautiful, but with the Vintage Inn, you may never want to leave your room. We just loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible!”
Reviews.Author: Valerie C
Reviews.Content: The Vintage Inn is amazing. It is in the perfect location within the perfect town (Yountville) in Napa Valley. You can walk to all of the best restaurants in the area, which is probably a good idea after a day of wine tastings. The rooms are SO beautiful. Ours had a fireplace, a balcony with a view of the vineyards (with the only downside being that Highway 29 was in between the two), a huge bathroom and tub, and a sitting area. The vaulted ceiling was so neat (but be aware that those ceilings are only on the second floor rooms, so make sure to request that. I peeked into a first floor room, and it wasn't nearly as special). The best part of the hotel, however, is the phenomenal breakfast they serve from 7-10 a.m. There is a chef to make eggs to order, fruits, cheeses, salmon, pastries, oatmeal, etc. But the best part is the unlimited Bloody Mary's and champagne! It was all so delicious. I would come back to this hotel again and again, and plan to. Yes, Auberge du Soleil has a more spectacular view. But it is not within walking distance of anything, and costs 2-3 times as much. You just can't go wrong with this lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem boutique hotel in the heart of Yountville.”
Reviews.Author: Renee48170
Reviews.Content: Very quaint, boutique hotel in the heart of Yountville. Great location, walking distance to shopping and several wonderful restaraunts. Champagne breakfast in the mornings was very nice and very good. Rooms were clean with alot of character. Would highly recommend and will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “THE Place to stay in Yountville!”
Reviews.Author: oliver80
Reviews.Content: The Vintage Inn cannot be beat for location, atmosphere, coziness, friendly staff, and that fabulous breakfast every morning! Upstairs rooms have vaulted ceilings so they feel a little larger, however, all rooms are nice and comfortable. My husband and I have stayed here at least 10 times and always consider this first! Everything in Yointville is expensive so don't let the price scare you, it is still usually a little less then the other hotels and by far more comfortable and friendly. The grounds are beautiful and the pool is very nice with comfortable lounges, lots of towels and lemon water. The staff is friendly, helpfull and obviously enjoy their jobs!

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: noid2
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Vintage Inn in Yountville. It is a charming property with very large king rooms and extremely tall vaulted ceilings (upstairs king only). The entire staff including the front desk were very accommodating. We arrived Monday morning about 10:30 am and were allowed to check in early. There was still Champagne left over from the complementary breakfast which they graciously allowed us to consume. Very nice start to a Napa vacation. As others have said the morning Champagne breakfast is wonderful. The pastries (especially the bread pudding) and omelet bar are wonderful. Was not around for the afternoon tea but hear that it is wonderful too. There was always a fully stocked barrel of cold bottled water out behind the lobby. We had an upstairs king near Washington Street with a large balcony, large bathroom, Jacuzzi tub and a very nice real fire place always stocked with an artificial log. Did occasionally hear some late night rowdies but not too bad. Our friends stayed in a king near highway 29 and did complain about the road noise at night. The pool and spa area are a little run down but that would not stop me from staying there as you have access to the Villaggio Resort which is a much newer property. However the walk to the Villaggio is longer than it would appear on the map given at check in. Check around for room specials which make the property a bargain before booking. Lovely peaceful grounds within walking distance to all Yountville restaurants. Yountville is our favorite place to stay in the area. Would definitely return if booked at a discounted rate. Oh yeah the beds are extremely comfortable. Slept very well.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: luckyBaltimore
Reviews.Content: Ask for an courtyard room and 2nd floor. Very quiet nice vaulted ceilings. Fantastic breakfast every morning. Desk staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Inn”
Reviews.Author: Kristi E
Reviews.Content: Had a great wine trip! Hotel was very convenient for walking to dinner. The breakfast was amazing. Would stay there again. We were weary about an outside room because of traffic noise, but not a problem, If you had a court yard room, the late night rowdy crowd, would have been worse!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ILStephanieChicago
Reviews.Content: What a great little hotel - perfectly located in Yountville - loved the afternoon tea and morning brunch - both with FREE alcohol!! and there are always bottles of water available...the price was a bit high - but I think worth it and we will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: FTMNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Vintage Inn is in a perfect location to walk to all of Yountville's restaurants and shops. The buffet breakfast (included w/ room price) is one of the best we've had anywhere. Rooms are big and nicely furnished. However, they are extremely dark. Bathrooms are nice, double sinks. Tub/shower a little awkward to get in and out of. We enjoyed our stay but it just didn't have that wow factor for us.

Reviews.Title: “Not as great as I hoped”
Reviews.Author: Seattletravel_11
Reviews.Content: I had heard nothing but great things about this property. I found it to be OK -- not great. It was difficult to find your way around the numerous small buildings. The bathtubs, it must be said, had high tiled sides, which make it difficult to step into -- and it was a combo bath/shower. The breakfast was delicious, but crowded. There was a small pool that we enjoyed sitting by. It is convenient to wineries, etc., but either go for a truly authentic experience or stay try a larger place with more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “could not have been more perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Party0fF0ur
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vintage Inn from Sept 6-9, 2011 and had a wonderful time! We enjoyed the beautiful surroundings and took advantage of the opportunity to rent bicycles from the front desk each morning. The lovely flowers and fountains added to the charm and glamor of this hotel. The champagne breakfast each morning was one of the best in recent memory. We loved being walking (or trolley) distance from all those wonderful restaurants. Yountville is such a great location for seeing the Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, convenient and great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: n2r49rs
Reviews.Content: The location for close proximity to the Yountville restaurants is clearly the winner here. Rooms a nice, not great. The breakfast buffet was awesome and service was top notch. We really enjoy sitting on a patio or balcony before dinner but these were nothing special. Great grounds though but many were blocked in by shrubbery.

Reviews.Title: “perfect!”
Reviews.Author: boogieandwoogie
Reviews.Content: we visited napa for my husband's 30th birthday. since we had never been, we used trip advisor to plan every aspect of our trip. we were wanting something with a cottage feel and based on reviews and photos, decided on vintage inn. we never regretted that decision! first of all, the place is adorable- little units of 4 rooms clustered together (2 upstairs, 2 downstairs). we were in an upstairs room. it had high ceilings, a fire place, and bonus- an AC unit and a ceiling fan!!! we are hot sleepers and prefer the noise of a fan so this was perfect for us! in addition, the bed was super comfy and the breakfasts (included in your stay) were amazing (from homeade waffles or omelets to mimosas and bloody marys)!!! we got everything we were hoping for out of this hotel: great location, fabulous room and a delicious breakfast each morning. i highly recommend the vintage inn!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the heart of yountville - amazing rooms and service”
Reviews.Author: cheloni
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay and very helpful and attentive staff. The rooms are great and spacious

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for couples”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Vintage Inn 8/31-9/2 and loved it. Perfect location with large comfortable rooms. They have a great breakfast in the morning and heated pool and jaccuzzi for later. Far from inexpensive, we did get a discount by using SniqueAway.com, which helped.

Reviews.Title: “This may be our new base in Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: JustinBoulder
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at Vintage Inn in August 2011. We normally don't stay at places with Vintage Inn's rack rate, but a set of deals (through Vintage Inn, AMEX, and Travelocity) ended up driving down our cost substantially. That said, now that we've stayed at Vintage Inn, we would be willing to pay more than we did to stay there again. We didn't take advantage of the spa, so we can't comment on its quality, although it looked very nice on the quick walkthrough we took. With that caveat, our favorite features of the inn were the room quality and cleanliness, the concierge service, and the daily champagne brunch. The rooms were well-appointed, clean, and comfortable. They weren't extravagant, and didn't need to be. The in-room Nespresso machine was a nice feature. The linens were newer and always clean. The cleaning staff did a great job in both the morning clean-up and the evening turn-down service. Vintage Inn's concierge was wonderful. We rolled into town during high season without a single appointment booked at any winery. Christina booked four days worth of tastings, accommodating our old favorites, some new spots, and a few that she recommended. We have a pretty good handle on which Napa wines we like, but Christina pointed us to some smaller places (<1,000 cases/yr) that we had never heard of, which we loved. She booked dinners and lunches for us, which made our time there much less stressful. Starting each day's tasting at Vintage Inn's champagne brunch was wonderful. They had a terrific spread of 10-15 dishes each morning - pastries, heirloom tomatoes, cheeses, quiche, potatoes... It's impossible to leave hungry. Omelets were available each morning, with waffles as well on the weekends. Some days, we would take a late breakfast and not even eat a lunch while out tasting. The free meal to start the day really cut down on our food bill on this trip. In all, we thoroughly enjoyed our time at Vintage Inn and can't wait to return. It is a fantastic place to stay in Napa Valley.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Very Nice Property”
Reviews.Author: whocareswhoiam
Reviews.Content: As are other inns in this area, the property is pricey. It is in an excellent location, walking distance to many good fine dining restaurants (Redds is our favorite) and a five minute drive to Etoile (upscale fine dining at its very best). Our first impression upon arrival was poor as the front desk offered to have a bellman meet us at our car to help with luggage. Unfortunately, we waited almost twenty minutes before deciding to schlepp our own bags to the room. Poor start, we mentioned this at check out. We declined the US Today paper and were to receive a .75 daily credit. It was not reflected on our bill. We suggest if they are not going to make the adjustment, that they do not offer the option to decline. At $400+ a day, this is not a major factor - but don't offer what you don't deliver. The room is very nice, very clean and very quiet. The second floor room had high volume ceiling with a ceiling fan. The wall unit A/C worked great. We did not use the fireplace, but it did add to the ambiance of the room. Old television was fine as we didn't use it often. The windows have shutters, must turn them up when closing at night to eliminate light from entering the room. During the daytime, the bedroom was a little dark. The outdoor patio was large and very nice, somewhat private. The bed was fluffy, great linens and pillows. The linens made it lux, yet it is a bit soft for anyone that likes a firm mattress. The bathroom is light and bright, with a large whirlpool tub (good size for one tall person, but a bit too small for a couple). It is a tub/shower combo. The showerhead worked fine but the way the water came out, we suggest a new showerhead be purchased. We especially enjoyed the double sinks. The amenities were very nice. The towels were fluffy and in great shape. Housekeeping is excellent here. The bed is well made, crisp. We especially loved that the sheets stayed in place and always looked freshly made. The bathroom was spotless although we suggest a bit of Tilex cleaner be used inside the window tiles to eliminate the mold that is accummulating from the shower spray hitting inside. A detail that should get as much attention during cleaning as the rest of the bathroom did. No mold anywhere else, so why not make that window part of the cleaning process. The breakfast provided is excellent. Fresh juice, champagne if you wish, were always available. The omelets were good, both regular or egg white only were offered, and a nice variety of items to add to the eggs. Breakfast potatoes were available, however no breakfast meats such as sausage or bacon. A cold cut of some sort was on the table. The breakfast breads were fresh, with butter, cream cheese and a lox spread. Hot oatmeal, granola, one type of cereal and fresh fruits. Green bean salad, tomato salad and a hot item were included. Overall, something for everyone. The display was well maintained and the area clean. The tables setting inside was very nice and there is an outdoor area as well. Both areas maintained by the staff, clean and inviting. A small bar offers drinks for purchase. A bucket of ice is stocked with complimentary water bottles. Afternoon tea is excellent, a nice snack of savory and sweet items offered. Complimentary tea, iced tea and lemonade as well as bottled waters are available. The bar is open all day if you wish to purchase an alcoholic beverage. Overall, both couples agreed that we would return to this hotel. Our favorite nearby restaurant was Redd. Others we liked were Bistro Jeanty, Bouchon and Ad Hoc. Etiole at Domaine Chandon is a staple for every visit we make - it is the best dining in Yountville and was awarded one Michelin star. We drove twenty minutes to LaToque at the Westin which was also an excellent meal. Bottega, next to the hotel, was touristy and unimpressive - we would not go back to Bottega. Service is "get 'em in and get 'em out" style.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: WineDineDive
Reviews.Content: Vintage Inn has comfortable luxury...and they allow pets. Napa Valley can be SO over the top about image, but staying at Vintage Inn, I feel the luxury, but not the pretentious qualities of the neighbor hotels. I had an interior courtyard room...which was VERY quiet, large, and comfortable. It also had a little patio...I think all the rooms have a patio or balcony. The breakfast was amazing...chapagne or Bloody Mary's with a hot breakfast served in the lobby. Even an omelet bar. You can walk out the front door to the best restaurants in the Valley. I ate at Hurley's which seems to be quite a locals place...and delicious. The Chef, Bob Hurley, was on hand greeting guests. The bartender there, however, was not my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great Yountville Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jrankin
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Vintage Inn over a weekend in mid-August. The property was totally full and had a nice buzz of people throughout the grounds and public spaces - when we arrived there was a wine & cheese reception and tasting in the lobby, which, combined with a friendly front desk staff made for a very nice greeting. Vintage Inn is probably the most centrally located in the town - you can walk to all the restaurants and shops in minutes. The grounds are lushly landscaped and very pretty, especially along the central fountain. Our room and bathroom was very large, and while the rooms and property are not as trendy as some of the neighbors, everything was attractive and well-appointed. When we made our reservation, the hotel staff seemed very proud of the breakfast that they offer, and I can see why - a great variety, including my favorite, chicken and waffles! As people have mentioned, there was free flowing champagne and made to order bloody marys and coffee drinks. We did not make it to tea, but it seemed like drinks and fruit were always available as well. I do need to mention one negative. I was travelling with a friend and we had very specifically requested a room with two beds. We were assigned a room with only one king, and because the hotel was full during our stay, they were not able to give us the correct room type. Both the front desk and the general manager were both quick to respond and extremely apologetic, but since we had booked through a third party site they were not able to credit us for any portion of our stay. Rollaway - not so great but it didn't spoil our stay. Spa at the neighboring Villagio was excellent, and as a guest of the Vintage Inn there are soem facilities you can use for free - definitely take advantage!

Reviews.Title: “A Charming Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Kutie16
Reviews.Content: The Vintage Inn is a charming place to stay in Yountville. We arrived early for check in, but were given a room immediately. The staff was friendly and assisted us to our room. Upon entering our room I was pleasantly surprised with how large and beautiful it was. Our complimentary bottle of wine was waiting for us on top of the fireplace. The grounds were impeccably maintained and the hotel is central to tasting rooms as well as many wonderful places to eat. We had lunch at Hurley's and dinner at Bouchon. Both were wonderful. Brunch in the morning was great and I was disappointed that we had to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Yountville IS Napa Valley, Vintage Inn IS Yountville”
Reviews.Author: FairWinds1
Reviews.Content: Large property in center of "restuarant row" in Yountville. Appeared to be the most desirable location in the valley, but who knows? Very pricey, but apparently consistent with the market in the area. Our upstairs room was very well designed, inviting, comfortable, and quiet. The only downsides were the stairs for handling luggage, the lack of a stand alone shower in an exquisite bathroom, and a balcony with only a view of the parking lot. A great location to center the Napa Valley experience for a few days. The concierge was very helpful with recommendations for tastings and made key restaurant reservations (in advance of our arrival). Breakfasts provided were truly first class in every respect. Staff at check in a bit less welcoming than what had been expected, but it is a LARGE property, not an intimate B&B. If we returned, we would demand an upstairs room with a balcony overlooking the courtyards or manicured grounds.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Great location”
Reviews.Author: BHale
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here and loved it. Not only is it in a great location in Napa Valley but within walking distance of some fabulous restaurants. The staff are very attentive. Breakfast is fantastic. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: pagriego
Reviews.Content: Vintage Inn is a favorite in Yountville and the Napa Valley. Wonderful beds and pillows and the grounds are immaculate. Fantastic location, close to world class dining, Bouchon, Bottega, Redd, Ad hoc, etc..... Their fresh omelette station and breakfast is a real treat and we looked forward to it each morning. Love the stay, didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Great spot if you like great food and wine”
Reviews.Author: m_r_d_atl
Reviews.Content: We really liked Yountville and really liked the Vintage Inn. My wife and I spent 3 night at the hotel earlir this month for a much needed no kids vacation. To us Yountville was the best part of Napa to stay, it is very nice and in a great location to enjoy all of the valley. It is high end with the prices to go with it but if you are looking for world class food and wine this is the place. The Vintage Inn is in a great location in town walking distance to 5-6 of the best resturants on the planet. The rooms are larger and more homey that a typical hotel room with a fire place and terrace. The hotel has a great brakfast and afternoon tea that was included in our rate as well as access to spa at the sister resort the Villagio which has steamrooms, hottubs etc...The Vintage Inn has nice grounds and its own pool area which is on the smaller side. We did the bike tour with Napa Bike Tours one day where we rode about 10 miles and hit 4 winerys and just drove around Napa and Heldsberg the other days. We ate at Bouchons (OK), Bottega (Great) and Bistro Jeanty (my favorite) which are all with in a couple blocks of the Vintage Inn. Overall Vintage Inn is a great place and we enjoyed our stay alot.

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay when visiting the Napa Valley”
Reviews.Author: Gifflynn
Reviews.Content: You couldn't ask for a better location, right in the middle of Yountville, with so many fabulous restaurants right within walking distance! We stayed in an inner courtyard upper level room and it was peacefully quiet at night and although it wasn't chilly enough to use the working fireplace we liked that we had the option - duraflame logs included. The room was very cosy and we enjoyed the little touches like L'Occitane toiletries. The grounds are immaculately maintained and the pool area is a great place to relax after a bit of touring, tasting and eating. I am sure we'll be back again and most likely will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “only good things to say...”
Reviews.Author: squeebie22
Reviews.Content: Loved our room and breakfast and afternoon tea. Pool area and surroundings are beautiful. Saturday morning waffles were delicious! Service excellent. For special occasion trip - 100% worth it.

Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel and it's sister property, Villagio”
Reviews.Author: patriotic
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice and it's sister property, the Villagio, three times. We love them both. Villagio is a little more modern. The Vintage Inn is smaller, quieter and well, more "vintage" and rustic. The afternoon tea is a nice touch and the breakfast at both properties is really great. We simply love Yountville. We will keep coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: mckj
Reviews.Content: My daughter ance.d I were celebrating out birthdays and stayed at the Vintage Inn and used the services of the Villagio Spa. The rooms were amazing and very well decorated. All amenities were provided including a bottle of wine and espresso coffee maker. It also included a breakfast in the mornings. The Villagio Spa was amazing as well. We got their "Girl Friend" spa package and it more than we expected. The people were all very professional and and really nice. At the end, we were taken to a balcony and served appetizers and champagne. Couldn't have asked for anything more.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place, great location”
Reviews.Author: kim_munson
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Vintage Inn while he attended a legal conference. The grounds were lovely, and the Inn is located conventionally right on the main street across from all the fabulous restaurants including the French Laundry. They served an amazing free breakfast every morning in the lobby (waffles and omelets made to order), held wine tastings, and etc. Our upper floor room was very nice, with a huge bathroom, outdoor deck overlooking the garden, fireplace and complimentary bottle of wine. Everyone was nice and helpful. We would stay there again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: catbluesky
Reviews.Content: We stayed in September during the "rush" or harvest season for wine country and were lucky to find such a great location with many amenities including a wonderful concierge. The day started out with a yummy morning brunch including mimosas, bloody marys, and fresh fruit, juices, breads, etc. The room was clean and the property grounds filled with lovely plantings, a waterway and many shady areas to rest. The pool was clean and the sister property (Villagio) spa and gym were included with the Vintage Inn.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: JenTal
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable relaxing stay in this hotel. While we felt it was dated to some degree rooms were large, clean and well appointed. Bed was extremely comfortable a must for my traveling. We stayed second floor in centre of hotel with a nice garden view, I spent many hours on balcony working on my computer while my husband attended a conference in hotel. Staff were so friendly nothing was a problem. Yes hotel is positioned just off the highway as most hotels are along this Road in Napa so traffic noise can be heard. When booking ask for room in centre of hotel. Noise did not both us at night, hotel makes an effort with wonderful fountains placed around room areas these absorb road noise. Brunch on the weekend is great. Good restaurants are walking distance as are many stores. Climate in area is amazing, hot during the day and cool at night, a shawl is very handy for night time. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my wildest expections!”
Reviews.Author: Caricky
Reviews.Content: This trip was for my wife's birthday and also joining us was my son and daughter-in-law who were celebrating their 10th wedding anniversary on the same day. My wife and I had stayed at the Vintage Inn around 25 years ago just after it opened so wanted to return again. The place still looks new. The staff, from gardner to general manager, were super friendly and could not do enough to make our stay special. Jeff, the manager, arranged our two rooms were very close to eachother even though the hotel was sold out. He even sent up a bottle of iced down Chandon champaign for our celebration. The rooms are large with fireplace and huge balcony. The bathrooms are very big also with double sinks and jacuzzi tub. The grounds were well kept and manicured with nice pool. If you want a peaceful and quiet place this is it. Buffet breakfast with made to order omelets is complimentary as is the afternoon tea time. Our room was very clean with nice carpeting and wood shutters on the many windows. I could not find one thing to be critical about with our stay. We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Anniversary at The Vintage Inn”
Reviews.Author: joni1953
Reviews.Content: Wow !!! This place is amazing ! The decor is French Country with lush flowering gardens and waterways throughout the immaculate property. Breakfast brunch, tea and wine tastings are served daily. The food and service are superb. Christiana was a very helpful concierge before and during our stay. We will certainly return to this paradise as they made our 35th anniversary a memorable one.

Reviews.Title: “The wedding of our dreams at the Vintage Inn”
Reviews.Author: JessieBPhotography
Reviews.Content: We fell in love at the Vintage Inn a couple years ago and chose to bring our closest friends and family back to share with them this hidden treasure location. We entrusted Vintage Inn with the most special day of our lives and had a wonderful experience planning our wedding there. Our Event Manager, Soo, is a dream come true for any couple trying to plan such a special day from thousands of miles away. She is friendly, organized, thorough, experienced, detail-oriented, helpful, and has an extremely positive attitude. After one conference call, we knew we were in good hands. Soo genuinely cared about the success of our special day and it showed in everything she did and how perfectly our day was executed. You can only hope to be lucky enough to work with her. In addition to Soo, the Catering Manager, Tom Stokey was also extraordinary. Our wedding ceremony and reception took place at the Groezinger Estate (also owned by Villagio). It was flawless and we know Tom played an important hand in it. He did the most generous thing for us after finding out that we decided to forgo floral centerpieces to keep costs down...he picked roses from his own personal garden and created the most breathtaking petal puddles in the center of the dinner tables. They were absolutely exquisite. Actions like these speak volumes to the caliber of staff employed by the Vintage Inn. The venue (Groezinger Estate) was absolutely breathtaking, the front grounds perfect for a small wedding ceremony, the food was fabulous, and the staff was exquisite. It was truly the wedding of our dreams and we look forward to celebrating future anniversaries at the Vintage Inn. -Adam & Jess B.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Lovely, Lovely”
Reviews.Author: sackjo22
Reviews.Content: The Vintage Inn doesn't seem to be as "high end" as some of the other properties in Yountville, but the staff is warm and responsive, the grounds are pretty and well kept. The room was very comfortable with a gorgeous bathroom that was impeccable, sporting a deep jacuzzi tub. There was a fireplace in the room, and I may have had the best "hotel sleep" I have ever had. The hotel cat visited us one night, making herself at home. If you dislike cats or are allergic, this could be a problem. But for us, this was a delight, continuing to make us feel welcome. There were a couple of minor incidents with our room (i.e., the toilet stopped up twice and the tv blew out), but the staff was immediately responsive and resolved the issues cheerfully. Also, the air conditioner in the room was very loud. Nonetheless, we would gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The PERFECT Place”
Reviews.Author: Luttrell
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here on our second trip to the wine country and the Vintage Inn is a fantastic hotel. The rooms are clean and comfortable, the grounds are wonderful and the lobby is a great gathering place. Wine & cheese in the evening and the breakfast is worth the stay. This will be out hotel of choice each time to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, service, clean and comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: aclavijo
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Vintage Inn. We originally had reservations at the Villagio - where apparently they did not get my Hotels.com reservation and called me 2 weeks prior to my stay to tell me the Villagio was full and they moved us to the Vintage Inn. Although I was originally disappointed, after staying at the Vintage Inn, I'm completely satisfied in my stay! I visited the facilities at the Villagio and I felt the place needed some updating. At the Vintage Inn, the rooms were comfortable, the breakfast was fabulous, the service was stellar! We would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “one of the cutest places we have stayed in years”
Reviews.Author: MrDateNight
Reviews.Content: Just being 100 yards from French Laundry, Bouchon, Bottega, Redd, Bistro Jeantry is enough to have a great stay but the staff was great. The Spa was brand new and had all the bells and whistles. The Concierge set up private tastings for us that blew us away. Its our favorite place near Napa!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Murdoughnut
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights at the Vintage Inn and had a great stay. Very beautiful property with an incredibly relaxing atmosphere. A bit pricey, but no more so than anything else in Yountville. The morning breakfast offerings were fantastic, and the grill cook will make you a great omelette. The rooms were very spacious and comfortable - with large bathrooms. There are a couple of cats living on the property which we thought was awesome - it was fun watching them prance around while laying by the pool. The only negatives I can think of ... they had a wine hour one night while we were there, but not the next night. Also, we were on the first floor and the sound of people walking on the floor above us was quite loud. I could imagine this bothering a lighter sleeper. But all in all, this is a great, relaxing hotel with a very friendly staff and a neat atmosphere. Would definitely stay here again if my travels bring me back here.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful & Centrally Located in Yountville”
Reviews.Author: catergrape
Reviews.Content: Vintage Inn is beautiful and located centrally in Yountville and 2 small blocks away from The French Laundry! Which we managed to secure reservations for. The hotel offers complimentary breakfast as well as an afternoon tea time. The rooms are immaculate with fireplaces inside and we even got a complimentary wine our first night! The bathroom boasts ample counter space with 2 sinks and a nice tub! We also got to use the spa facilities at their sister resort down the block. The staff are lovely and quire accommodating, my only complaint was one housemaid that would bang the door as if it was the apocalypse. A simple 'knock knock' typically suffices for me. Amenities: L'Ocittane

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to begin our life together!”
Reviews.Author: almtapp
Reviews.Content: We were "gifted" with 4 nights at the Vintage Inn for our honeymoon. It was by FAR the best wedding gift we received!! We were in the room right behind the main fountain. It was quiet, peaceful and perfect! We loved fireplace (we lit a fire every night), loved the bathroom with the jacuzzi tub, the bed was super comfy, and loved how close our hotel was to everything. The morning brunch was to die for...I've been trying to re-create the banana bread pudding since we returned! So yummy! The concierge was a great help in lining up tastings and dinner reservations for us...and even found some discounts for us to use! We loved everything about the Vintage Inn...and can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: NewportBeacher
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located in Yountville. We have stayed here several times. Appreciate there pet friendly policy. They always provide excellent service - afternoon tea, wine tasting, fabulous breakfast. Rooms in general are a good size with lots of windows. Love the Nespresso coffee makers in your room and l'occitain bath amenities. The down comforter and sheets are nice quality and cozy. However the tv's are really old with poor picture quality. For the price they should have new HD quality flat screen tv's. Also some of the furnishings could be updated at bit. Overall we really enjoy this property and hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: quartergreek
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Vintage Inn. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable . It was very cold when we were there so the fireplace and tub were especially appreciated. They have a nice wine tasting and cheese hour in the afternoon. The breakfast was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast buffet and close to everything”
Reviews.Author: TrippinRobby
Reviews.Content: This is a very romantic place. The room was beautiful. A bottle of wine is waiting in your room. There is a great whirl pool bath in the bathroom. The location is perfect. It's right next to world class restaurants. The service was great. We enjoyed a great breakfast buffet with an omelet bar.

Reviews.Title: “The master bedroom you wish you had at home”
Reviews.Author: cedred
Reviews.Content: Warm, cottage feel with wooden shutters, fireplace, jacuzzi tub and down featherbeds w/ duvets. Plenty of room, yet cozy, comfortable and unpretentious. Tasty European style brunch included. Choose a room in the center so you're not too close to the roads on either side of the property. Concierge is fabulous, with suggestions for vineyards outside of the mainstream. Connections to spa and restaurant are helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place in the World”
Reviews.Author: horowitzfamily
Reviews.Content: Napa is the place by nature but this hotel,the people that work a this location they are wonderful,stay there just 2 days . and i want to go back ,the memories of there me and my wife will stay forever.THank you for all love love . Geraldo and Daniele

Reviews.Title: “A Very Friendly Place”
Reviews.Author: RGT6416
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times over the past 10 years and always look forward to returning. The staff, as always, could not be more open and inviting, always asking how they can help. The breakfast continues to be terrific, especially the Irish egg salad. However, I think the property needs to be freshened up a bit. The rooms need to be updated, with some kind of desk space or working area to take advantage of the free internet service. The televisions are ancient, at least 10 year old monsters with poor picture quality. We will certainly continue to return to one of our favorite places and hope a few changes will there to greet us.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel with amazing breakfast”
Reviews.Author: KatieB25
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Wednesday Dec 29th for a 3 night stay. The staff were so friendly and welcoming and offered us an upgrade to a suite. The room was very spacious with high ceilings, a fireplace and balcony overlooking a quiet garden. There was a welcoming bottle of excellent Chardonnay waiting for us and the bed and room were extremely comfortable. Next morning we arrived in the lobby for breakfast and were amazed at the array of food, which included Mimosas with excellent Mumm Champagne. Tea and coffee with pastries and sandwiches were served in the afternoon. The location is very convenient with 6 great restaurants within walking distance and wineries easily reached by car. This is one of the nicest hotel experiences I have had anywhere and we left very reluctantly on Saturday with plans to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent!”
Reviews.Author: ShariLemmen
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with friends and really enjoyed it. The rooms were beautifully appointed, beds really comfortable, fabulous HUGE bathroom and the breakfast was excellent. We are already planning to return next year!

Reviews.Title: “disapointing”
Reviews.Author: fellowtravelor77
Reviews.Content: We paid almost six hundred dollars for this room. Ouch! We stayed at calistoga ranch the next night for a couple hundred more and that was worth every penny. This was a special birthday, and we had managed to get into french laundry. We were however disapointed with the room. The joke was that any moment Blanch from the golden girls was going to jump out of the armoire. I love french country, and I understand the look they were or in the past had indeed mastered, but it is time for a facelift, or a price reduction!!!! I read the reviews after I had already booked it, and had I read them first would have not stayed here. There seems to be united feeling about this place.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Inn - Pet friendly & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MMMargarine
Reviews.Content: Altho it was a bit noisy during the day with all the yardwork outside and people walking in and out above our room, this was a lovely place to get away to. Our dogs loved it and we enjoyed that it was within walking distance of Bouchon/Bakery and the shopping plaza. They also had a great Sunday brunch.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Many Aspects Of This Place, Yet...”
Reviews.Author: deja_pseu
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here at the end of September. The Vintage Inn is indeed a beautiful property in a terrific location (if there were a "restaurant heaven", I'd bet it'd look pretty much like this patch of Yountville - although I'd hope the dinner reservations were a bit more accessible). The rooms are spacious and quiet. The bathrooms are enormous (in a good way)! Breakfasts are wonderful, with a variety of options available, and so is the afternoon "tea" with lots of yummy tidbits. Christina the Concierge is brilliant and extremely helpful (thanks so much for helping us to locate Rubissow Vineyards at the top of Mt. Veeder!)! The Front Desk staff were exceptionally helpful in making a last minute adjustment to our reservation. All that said, I did have a few small concerns. Television reception (I know, shame on me for turning it on at all, but...) on some of the primary network channels was extremely snowy - which we were told was a function of less-than-ideal cable service on the Property. We also had a lamp on our nightstand that periodically flickered and a clock/radio/cd player that wouldn't play cds. Finally, internet wi-fi connectivity was intermittent at best and speed draggingly slow. We raised most of these matters with the Front Desk and they were prompt in checking into them - but ultimately, they weren't able to resolve the TV reception situation, internet speed or the mysteriously intermittent flickering lamp. As I said, small concerns - but a bit disconcerting for a Property of this stature and price. Bottom line - a wonderful Inn we were glad to have visited; and we certainly would like to try it again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: rinmo04
Reviews.Content: i had a WONDERFUL stay at vintage inn. The bathroom is spacious and great with L'OCCITANE products (although the moisturizer is not the best they carry by far). The breakfast was my favorite part though - fantastic and in a class of its own. We stayed in room 603 and while the fire place, terrace and space in the room were great, the AC wasn't great and the highway behind the parking lot was a bit loud at night (with windows open). I would definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Little piece of heaven”
Reviews.Author: ZCastro
Reviews.Content: The Vintage Inn is located in the town of Yountville, which is centrally located in Napa. It is charming in its set-up, with country-French design and hometown friendliness. The rooms were very comfortable, but they could use a small update here and there. Nevertheless, I'm reaching to find something wrong with this place. The morning breakfast is out of this world---think sparkling wine from Mumm's and ready made omelets and waffles. The frontdesk service is superb (Christina is wonderful!). One of the best things about Vintage Inn is that it is walking distance to fabulous restaurants (Bottega, Redd, Ad Hoc, Bouchon). The price is a little steep, but honestly, it is well worth it (as is upgrading to an upstairs King with the vaulted ceilings). I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “We stayed at the Vintage Inn for 3 days...”
Reviews.Author: Crazyscotsman
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vintage Inn for 3 days during our California roadtrip for our honeymoon. It was excellent. Great champagne breakfast, amazing afternoon tea, lovely pool, super staff, an awesome spa (at villagio - as a guy I've never seen anything like it) and lovely rooms. The only negative which is similar for several yountville properties is it's proximity and therefore noise from the main road. It is handy for wine tours and what a selection of restaurants from super posh to more relaxed with BYO! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: CastrovilleTX
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights at Vintage Inn - great location, large rooms and bathrooms, nice pool and hottub and amazing breakfast. We really lucked out that our first choices had been booked. I can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend getaway to Yountville”
Reviews.Author: calgirlsanjose
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 15 year old granddaughter and I wanted to get some getaway for the weekend. We made last minute reservations at the Vintage Inn in downtown Yountville. My husband wanted to buy wine, my granddaughter and I just wanted to get some sun, swim and go out to dinner. We lucked out with staying at the vintage inn. The price was the best we could find at the last minute. The rooms was huge, bathroom was large and comfortable and the service is friendly and excellent. What made is a great deal was all the unexpected bonuses. Breakfast included for all three of us included made to order omelets and everything else you would want plus mimosas, then there was afternoon tea which was plentiful. One night we have a free wine and cheese cocktail hour. Also, we had great pool food and drink service. Everyone is very pleasant and welcoming. The inn exceeded my expectations, this is my third time here and it is still a great place if you don't want to spend a lot of money. PS: they make dinner reservations for you too, plus spa reservations at Villagio.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, wheater and service.”
Reviews.Author: Denyson
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a fantastic location in Napa, with a beautiful view of all winery properties and the wheater is just perfect. The rooms need some improvement like a better TV, a better place to connect and work with your computer, a much better internet connection and wardrobe with more internnal space. Also the transportation between the hotel and the SFO airport is terrible. The hotel service otherwise is just outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Service is luxury; rooms need a major facelift.”
Reviews.Author: SuperWaterGirl
Reviews.Content: Here's the problem: The service and the rooms don't match up. The first is fantastic, the latter leaves much to be desired. I was here with 3 friends. We shared one hotel room w/ 2 beds - the price was $580 per night. This is the most expensive hotel room I've ever had, so I was expecting something extraordinary. When we first saw the room itself, we all felt like we had been duped. It was small and looked like any old chain hotel room. The decor felt very outdated and just old in general. The bathroom was nice though, with a huge jacuzzi tub and L'Occitane bath products. The room itself is not worth the money, but I'll tell you what IS worth the money. The service. They leave you a complimentary bottle of wine in your room upon check-in, which i thought was a great touch. They also offer a complimentary champagne brunch, which was plentiful and delicious. Made-to-order waffles, omelettes, and huge displays of pastries, breads, fruit, juices, coffee, sweets. My fiance and I spent one day by the pool, and an employee made several rounds offering drinks and extra treats like a bowl of cold raspberries and sunglass cleaner wipes. We also enjoyed the afternoon tea and sandwiches in the lobby. And it should be noted that the property itself is truly gorgeous. Lots of greenery, pretty fountains. So my only complaint is the rooms. A good makeover, and this place will feel more like the $500/night place it sells itself as.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Sondra W
Reviews.Content: Check in was friendly and efficient. The room was large and comfortable with a wood burning fireplace. A bottle of wine is in your room the first night. The bed is incredibly comfortable. There are two coffee makers; a Nespresso and a drip, both with coffee supplied and the champagne breakfast is wonderful! WiFi in the room. It's a complex of small buildings of two floors and I would recommend getting a room on the second floor. I highly recommend this place because it is so comfortable and I like the way they don't nickle and dime you for every little thing.

Reviews.Title: “Don't get Hustled, Stay Elsewhere, Save and Get Spoiled!”
Reviews.Author: Winetrvlrs
Reviews.Content: Five hundred a night is a bit steep for a Motel 6 like experience. Paper thin walls and ceilings, staff that started vacuuming the outdoor sidewalks at 8:30 am, dingy rooms and you can every footstep on the ceiling above you. Nothing "charming" about this place. The previous summer we stayed at Bardesono for a hundred less and an out of this world experience (unfortunately it was booked). Yountville is a perfect setting, but the Vintage Inn is not! Felt hustled and would NEVER recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Zandago
Reviews.Content: The Vintage Inn is perfectly located in the Napa Valley. It's just off the main road so you don't get the traffic of all the people traveling between the wineries but still very close to the tasting rooms and wineries. The room decor was slightly dated, not terribly so still very nice. Bathroom was very spacious with a great jetted tub. Very peaceful setting for just kicking back on the back porch and reading a book. Internet is free which is a nice perk. The included breakfeast was one of the best I've ever had at a hotel. The Vintage Inn is actually part of a larger complex and staying at the Inn includes free use of the spa. Very relaxing place to stay. The hotel staff was also very helpful with recommendations restaurants and making reservations. Great restaurants very nearby (very short walks). Thomas Keller's Bouchon and French Laundry are right there. Bistro Jeanty was a great place for dinner. Tom Chiarello's Bottega is right next door. Great eats!

Reviews.Title: “It is all that AND a bag of chips.”
Reviews.Author: AuntieJoy
Reviews.Content: The Vintage Inn is our favorite place to stay in the Napa Valley. It isn't the cheapest, but don't let that stop you from choosing this lovely Provencale treasure. The location is very convenient, close to the best restaurants in Napa and just off the main highway. The peaceful setting belies the undercurrent of constant activity of the busy staff, all there to cater to your every need. Not only can you avail yourself of the luxurious spa amenities at the neighboring Spa Villagio, you can rent bikes here, enjoy the sumptuous complimentary champagne breakfast or the very civilized afternoon tea service. Every Friday evening, a local vineyard sets up a table in the lobby and hosts a wine and cheese hour. What a perfect setting for your Napa vacation. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect doesn't begin to describe the Vintage Inn”
Reviews.Author: xcapeohio
Reviews.Content: The other reviews have been very accurate, this place is incredible!! The staff is one of the friendliest, most helpful staff we have ever stayed with. The rooms are huge and they have every luxury; jacuzzi, fireplace...etc. The breakfast buffet in the morning is one of the best we have had at a hotel. The location is close to the famous restaurants. What a value, what an amazing place. The manager deserves major praise for such a well run hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Like visiting a friend's charming country house”
Reviews.Author: VistaDelSol
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Vintage Inn on a leisure weekend in wine county and found it to be very pleasant -- like visiting an old friend's charming country house -- not pretentious, just cozy and friendly. When we arrived there was an afternoon tea set up in the lobby with lots of savories and sweets. At check-in the front desk upgraded our room (as they did for several others too) so we had a mini-suite facing the inner courtyard and fountains. The room had a beverage bar, eating area, fireplace, whirlpool tub, French country decor, and complimentary wine. Very comfortable. Next morning breakfast was included for all guests, either on the patio or in the lobby dining room. There were omelettes made to order, a variety of pastries, plus other interesting and tasty items. We enjoyed walking through the gardens and pathways on the grounds. There's a pool, which we didn't use because weather was chilly, and a spa next door at their sister hotel Villagio. Overall, we found Vintage Inn to be a well-kept property with a friendly staff, and we could easily walk to all the shops and restaurants in Yountville.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Rooms - Wonderful Staff - Amenities Galore”
Reviews.Author: Meanwhile
